description:
Today, NVIDIA is tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. An era in which our GPU acts as the brains of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can understand the world. Doing what’s never been done before takes vision, innovation, and the world’s best talent. As an NVIDIAN, you’ll be immersed in a diverse, encouraging environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work. Come join the team and see how we can make a lasting impact on the world.
Video/Multimedia Architecture Group is an idiosyncratic group of people that seed and evangelize the technology for Video Compression engines. The group's responsibility is to research, invent, set the technological roadmap, and define the architecture to make it a product. We are looking for a passionate M.Sc./Ph.D. Student, who loves challenges to join our Video/Multimedia Architecture team. The Individual chosen for this position will have the opportunity to take an active part in researching and developing state-of-the-art Video Compression and Video Pre-/Post- Processing Algorithms and Architecture aimed to be deployed into Nvidia’s world-class consumer and data center products. Come and help us lead the next generation of video!
What you will be doing:
Master our Video Algorithms and Architecture
Research and evaluate algorithms currently used in related applications.
Test and measure constantly the quality improvements of the design step, quantify them, and document them.
Define the SI architecture and SW algorithms for different design groups (worldwide)
What we need to see:
M.Sc./Ph.D. student in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Software Engineering.
Domain interest and area of research is in one or more: Image processing or Computer vision, Machine learning, or 3D graphics algorithms
Experience in OOP/OOD with C++ and Python
Passion for problem-solving and Algorithms research and development
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Actual experience with C++/Python Algorithmic Frameworks such as OpenCV, Numpy, SciPy, CuPy, matplotlib, etc.
Working knowledge of one of the most popular Artificial Intelligence development frameworks (e.g TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, etc.)
Knowledge in video compression standards.

job: Cloud Quality - MSc/PhD Summer internship 2023 - Research Lab

description:
NVIDIA has been redefining computer graphics, PC gaming, networking and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s an outstanding legacy of innovation that’s motivated by phenomenal technology.
We are now looking for a motivated Chip Architect Student to use creativity and problem solving skills to work on the ConnectX network adapter and Bluefield Data Processing Unit with the highly inventive and knowledgeable team
What you'll be doing:
Be part of the team that defines the Network Adapter chip and Data processing Unit architecture end to end from the market requirements through design and all product life cycles (post/pre-silicon, on deployments).
Perform research and analysis on real systems and simulation tools for deployed products and innovate for future solutions.
Collaborate with other research teams.
Develop Proof of Concepts using our technology, collaborating with our most sophisticated customers on state-of-the-art innovations.
What we need to see:
Student for B.Sc. in Electrical or Computer Engineering.
Programming skills.
Knowledge and understanding of compute and networking systems.
Can-do attitude and high energy with leadership and excellent interpersonal skills and possess the ability to learn complex concepts in a fast pace environment.
Passion and attention to details in design and a high focus on design quality.
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience and love for system architecture, CPU/GPU/Memory/Storage/Networking.
